decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed conversion, by reason of the loss of the existing family sized unit and failure to re-provide at least one family sized unit, would be contrary to the requirements of Merton's Core Strategy Policy CS 14.

Reason : 2 - The proposed conversion, by reason of the provision of an undersized unit (Flat 2), would result in an unsatisfactory and substandard offer of residential accommodation to the detriment of the amenities of future occupiers. This would be contrary to the London Plan (2021) Policy D6, Merton's Sites and Policies Plan (2014) Policy DM D2 and the DCLG's Technical Housing Standards (nationally described space standards) (2015).

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE:
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.

Reason : 4 - INFORMATIVE: 
To avoid potential enforcement action, the applicant is advised to seek full planning permission/a certificate of lawfulness (whichever is considered the most appropriate) to retain the 6m rear extension.
description: CONVERSION OF SINGLE DWELLINGHOUSE INTO 2X SELF-CONTAINED UNITS (COMPRISING 1X 2 BED AND 1X 1 BED UNITS).
